perturbation.explanation: The data protection clause is moved into a section dealing with complaints and problem-solving related to invoices. This makes it less visible and harder to find for parties reviewing the contract for data protection obligations, potentially violating Indian data protection laws and GDPR if the PC Financial services the EU.

perturbation.original_text: 10.3 This Agreement (and any question about its subsistence, effect or termination) is to be interpreted in accordance with the laws of India, save for that body of law which governs the conflict of laws. The courts of New Delhi shall have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute between the Parties whether arising In connection with this agreement or otherwise. In the event of any dispute with respect to the construction, execution and performance of the provisions of this Agreement, such dispute shall be settled by arbitration in accordance with the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996 and rules made thereunder in force as on that date. The arbitration shall be carried out in English language and the venue/seat of arbitration shall be New Delhi. The Arbitration award shall be final and binding on the parties.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.3 This Agreement (and any question about its subsistence, effect or termination) is to be interpreted in accordance with the laws of India, save for that body of law which governs the conflict of laws. The courts of New Delhi shall have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute between the Parties whether arising In connection with this agreement or otherwise. In the event of any dispute with respect to the construction, execution and performance of the provisions of this Agreement, such dispute shall be settled by arbitration at the discretion of PC Financial, in accordance with the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996 and rules made thereunder in force as on that date. The arbitration shall be carried out in English language and the venue/seat of arbitration shall be New Delhi. The Arbitration award shall be final and binding on the parties.
perturbation.explanation: By adding 'at the discretion of PC Financial', the arbitration clause is altered to benefit one party. Originally it was binding but now only at the discretion of PC Financial. This significantly weakens the enforceability of the arbitration agreement and contradicts standard practices where arbitration agreements are intended to be mutually binding.

perturbation.original_text: 3.3 PC Financial represents and warrants that on the Effective Date and during the Service Period of this Agreement: (a) it will conduct its business in Territory in accordance with applicable law and without violating the rights of any third party; and (b) in connection with the conduct of its business in Territory, as well as its performance of this Agreement, PC Financial and Its affiliates will not violate any provision of the US Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, the UK Bribery Act, or any anti-corruption related laws in the Territory. 2
perturbation.changed_text: 3.3 PC Financial represents and warrants that on the Effective Date and during the Service Period of this Agreement: (a) it will conduct its business in Territory in accordance with applicable law and without violating the rights of any third party; and (b) in connection with the conduct of its business in Territory, as well as its performance of this Agreement, PC Financial and Its affiliates will make commercially reasonable efforts to not violate any provision of the US Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, the UK Bribery Act, or any anti-corruption related laws in the Territory. 2
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'will not violate' to 'will make commercially reasonable efforts to not violate', the obligation is weakened. This introduces ambiguity and reduces the enforceability of the anti-corruption provision. It suggests that violations may occur as long as 'commercially reasonable efforts' were made, creating a loophole that could undermine compliance with anti-corruption laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: US Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, UK Bribery Act, Anti-corruption laws in India (weakened compliance)
